Reviews.Title: “good for it's location”
Reviews.Author: Georgian76
Reviews.Content: Yes, very small room, no air conditioning (we don't needed in June), noisy reception, noisy during the morning cleanup, elevator not working, etc... But the location is good, near Barceloneta subway station. The staff was not speaking English, but they were kind and helpful. The towels were changed every day.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday from Hell”
Reviews.Author: Brenda S
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a cruise package with Major Cruise.co.uk as part of 50th birthday celebration. When I arrived in Barcelona and checked the paperwork sent by this company I soon found out that they had not bothered to include any postal address or telephone number for the hotel. I even asked a local taxi driver to take me there and he had not heard of the place either. This rseulted in me having to phone England to find out where I was actually going. (I should have smelt a rat right there). When I eventually arrived at the hotel I found out that the room I was staying in had a boarded up window. (not the best view I have ever enjoyed). In the morning I went down to get breakfast only to be offered a map to take me to another hotel where breakfast (which was not very nice at all) was served. This was the only day that I had in Barcelona and the icing on the cake for me was that there was no left luggage facility in the hotel resulting in me then having to go to the airport for most of the day as this was my only option to keep my suitcases safe. This was not how I had hoped to spend my birthday and due to the incompetence of both majorcruise.co.uk and the Lyon Hotel I missed out on having any chance of sightseeing in Barcelona (something that I was obviously looking forward to). On return to Scotland I have made a variety of complaints to majorcruise.co.uk in writing, over the telephone and by e-mail and at the time of writing have had no satisfactory response. They have even tryed to deny recieving my e-mails which I was then able to prove was a complete and utter lye. I would stongly advise anyone who considering using majorcruise.co.uk or the Hotel Lyon to think seriously about trying to book with someone else. Or be prepared to have your holiday ruined. Billy from Motherwell.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a hotel”
Reviews.Author: marjan_k
Reviews.Content: I have no idea what kind of a person will call this dump A hotel. Smells like a rubbish dump, no Internet, looks like spooky horror movies. I would not stay here even for 5 minutes. I had to leave as soon as I saw the room. HORRIBLE

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: melaniascalfaro
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE!!!a true hovel, uncomfortable, tiny room with staggering beds. You have to come back into midnight, if you come later they will leave you on the street because the hotel managers go away for the night. There is no breakfast, you have to go to another hotel and there the breakfast is poor: only ONE brioche!!The hotel is located in an apartment at 2 floor of a building, the lift is old and unregular! PLEASE GO TO ANY OTHER PLACE IN BARCELONA!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disgusting!!”
Reviews.Author: denisedolan
Reviews.Content: My sister and I visited the 'hotel' during late November. There are no words for the place it was ville! After spending many hours trawling the many streets looking for the place, we finally can across a gate with a small brass plate saying Hotel Lyon. We pressed the buzzer and we entered a large entrance hall. The hall way was dark and dingy with paint chipping from the walls but worst of all there was a very strong smell of urine! it was truly awful. There was nobody to greet us, we called out for service and knocked on doors even to the extent of climbing to the first floor but we found no persons for the 'hotel'. I really doubted if this was a genuine hotel. I would not recommended it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona in June”
Reviews.Author: IrekW
Reviews.Content: I was in Barcelona a few days with the teenage son. Our goal was to explore the city. The hotel is very modest, even spartan but is located in a very good point of the city. Very easy access to the airport, such as subway and train Nearby is the Barri Gotic district, which you can walk on foot. For other attractions can be reached quickly by subway

Reviews.Title: “Great to sleep, then go see the sights.”
Reviews.Author: LondonAston01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lyon over Easter weekend in 2010. I recommend the hotel if, like me, you are going to use it is a base for sight seeing. I do not recommend it if you are in a slightly older age group or expect to spend a lot of time at the hotel. The place is relativley clean and ok to find - it's the top half of an apartment building off a side road. My room was right near reception and as other posts have explained, it is a very noisy hotel. Though I am a good sleeper so whilst it was annoying when it occurred it was easily forgotten by breakfast - which I strongly recommend that you do not use the hotel (down the road) - be like a local and have a delicious breakfast at a nearby café! Please note - I was the victim of an attempted assault during my stay in Barcelona. I was waiting for my partner in the park near the hotel - when three men tried to steal my DSLR camera through an orchestrated series of events: one squirted a thick liquid on my back (I think it was make-up), another tried to convince me it was bird droppings and offered me a tissue whilst the third swooped in a literally tried to grab the camera from my hands - luckily I wasn't that slow and they ran away. Please be sensible with your belongings.

Reviews.Title: “After Initial Dramas-Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: GunnerJoe
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at Hotel Lyon, not too hard to find if you have the address and have read the reviews on here, we had a big discussion with the little old lady (she spoke no english and us no spanish(probs our fault too unprepared but on a big trip too)). She was trying to tell us our room had changed due to noise levels and this took at least 30 minutes and if she had not said so would have been fine we never would have known the difference. The difficulties were that at first it seemed like she was saying we were getting kicked out of an already paid for hotel not good. The good stuff- Close to everything if you dont mind 5 minute walks Staff clean well- we would go to breaky for 20 minutes and come back and our bed was made a fresh. Open 24 hours- just press the button down stairs. The bad stuff- Hilariously poor breakfasts No tv in our room-didnt matter to us Noisy but expected Overall a pleasant stay and would come again if we went back to barca...maybe

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lyon in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Discovergut
Reviews.Content: Good location, but hard to find because there is no sign, only a button at the call plant door Television is poor only 14T and 6 channels, the rooms are OK clean and simple and most of all its cheap

Reviews.Title: “Great location for little money”
Reviews.Author: Jennypennan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lyon for 7 nights and we didn´t expect that much, considering the price we payed; approximately 460 euros for 7 nights for 2 persons. When we got there we were happily surprised. Yes, the room was small and simple but everything was clean and fresh. Towels were changed every day and the room was cleaned every day. The bathroom was great, newly renovated and with an effective shower. The best was the location, you can easily walk to the beach and to all the tapas bars and there is also the Barceloneta Metro station just around the corner. The staff speaks little english but as long as you know bodylanguage and a few words of spanish, then it´s fine. If we should complain on something it as to be the airconditioner in the room during night. It was not very effective and when the temperature rises it´s a bit too hot.

Reviews.Title: “Noisest place ever”
Reviews.Author: kv505
Reviews.Content: I was given a room right near the miniscule reception area. Every time the phone rang, or someone rung the bell (yes!) to get in I was woken up. I had to argue with the the night clerk to turn down his TV (he did). The next night I changed rooms, farther from the reception desk, but still noisy. The 3rd night I finally got a room (#14) that was acceptable. The place itself would not be that bad - the bathrooms are modernized - they do give you plenty of towels. The bed in the 2nd room was VERY soft, the mattress basically worn out. All rooms are either street facing, or interior light shafts. You cam hear the neighbors, barking dogs, sirens... almost all non-stop. Not a place for anyone interested in getting any rest. The Santa Marta down the street, owned by the same company and where bkfst is served, looks better, but the staff is just as surly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Stevster
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lyon hotel for two nights and my stay was OK. It was a bit hard to find the entrance, because the hotel was on the second floor in an apartment block and you had to call for the lady upstairs to open the door. She only spoke spanish so it was a bit difficult to communicate. Well, the room was OK but really small with only one window. The bathroom was even smaller with a tiny bathtub/shower. Overall the room was like most rooms in 1-star hotels. A simple breakfast was served in a sister hotel just a minute away, The best thing with this hotel is the location. It takes only about 10 minutes to walk to the beach...

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: traveller2somewhere
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel. The room was without any ´frills´ and the bathroom too. Staff were friendly and spanish speaking. It was the cheapest ensuite hotel we could find but was not cheap compared to other destinations we have been to. Its location perhaps makes up for its shortcomings as a metro is a few minutes away and the station for the train to the airport only 3 or 4 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you stay at Hotel Lyon...an experience you'll never forget”
Reviews.Author: BarcaBoys
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lyon is a small hotel tucked away in a little road in central Barcelona; a very short stroll from the Estacio de Franco. Due to the fact it occupies the "second" floor of an apartment block, its pretty difficult to find. I say "second" floor because in actual fact you climb about four flights of stairs to get there. There is a lift but I didn't think my travel insurance covered me for death whilst in such a contraption. Arriving in the daytime you will be greeted and looked after by "Grandma Lyon" who will cater for your every desire. The rooms, though basic, are clean and comfy. Dont expect anything like internet connections, fax, turn-in service (unless you particularly like Grandma Lyon, or she likes you), or room service. Air con comprises a hole in the window which is partially covered by a wooden block - this is a converted flat with a local feel about it. Everybody looks after themselves. I would particularly recommend this place for Spanish omlette lovers. The best bit though is the night porter. What a hoot he is. He absolutely LOVES fooling around and he will not miss an opportunity to play a practical joke on you! He's a terrific bloke. I advise that you play a joke on him first, before he gets you. You'll know he's in when you press the buzzer outside and are greeted with a deep growling "Siiiiiiiii.....?" Considering the high prices of other hotels in Barcelona, this is a gem of a find. Apparently it has now become traditional to entertain the night porter with a joke. In fact, he won't let you leave without one!

Reviews.Title: “what an experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: rochelle*a
Reviews.Content: struggled to find hotel-if it wasnt for our brilliant taxi driver who spoke more english than the hotel staff we never would have. when you walk in there is just a dodgy old lift and no signs to indicate where reception is, we climbed 4 flights of stairs before we located a grumpy old manuel who spoke no english, our rooms were very small and basic with a fabulous view of a building site! bathroom extremely small but clean.had ancient 70s style phone and tv,heating was on full blast and couldnt be turned off. be warned if you go in summer the windows are very hard to open however there was a little pidgeon hole that you could open for fresh air in the mornings (or for our friends case whose heating was broken and pidgeon hole had no flap they had constant air conditioning). breakfast was a mission to find and turned out to be located in a hotel down the road and consisted of a croissant and tea-if you didnt like it you had nothing.. manuel did not appreciate us coming in at 6 am. there was mould round ceilings. however was close to the beach and marina and made great entertainment for our weekend away. recomend to all haha

Reviews.Title: “Beware Hotel Website Descriptions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want VERY basic accommodation then this is the place for you. The hotel is actually 2 floors within a private apartment block. The staff do not speak any english (so good luck trying to ask for a safe deposit box for your valuables). There is a v.small recepton area with no security. If you are unfortunate to have a room that leads directly on to the reception area (like i had) you will get very little sleep. The 'Nite Porter' spends his time watching the TV with the volume turned up, or snorning & farting loudly on a plastic sofa. Sound proofing is also poor as you can hear all neighbouring room conversations & activities. Ask for a hairdryer and you will be handed a broken piece of plastic which i am sure brakes some sort of health & safety regs. My room had no air conditioning, or telephone, overall this is a v.poor hotel & no where near what the various websites describe it as being.
